{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3352986,"name":"Ryan zheng","username":"Rzheng1232","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rzheng1232/{size}/182897_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-05T16:43:44.389Z","cooked":"

Hey!
I have a question about our autonomus paths:
Our paths are running fine translationally, however when we command in pathplanner for the robot to rotate, the robot doesn’t rotate at all.
Uploading: image.jpg…

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2024-04-05T16:43:44.389Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":13,"reads":145,"readers_count":144,"score":94.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":461390,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-autonomous-no-robot-rotation","display_username":"Ryan zheng","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55168,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-autonomous-no-robot-rotation/461390/1","custom_user_title":"Programmer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3352999,"name":"Ryan zheng","username":"Rzheng1232","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rzheng1232/{size}/182897_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-05T17:29:35.477Z","cooked":"

We printed out the chassis speeds the pathplanner was supplying to the robot and apparently the value was close to 0 despite the rotation we are adding to the path. We are sure that our setting module states for the path works since we over rode the pathplanner supplied chassis rotational speeds and the robot still rotated. Does anybody have any ideas

I am not sure if the problem is in my computer or not but can’t see your photo. From your explanations, I would check the rotation error between your gyro reading and path state at the specific time. Sometimes people also confuse rotation and heading as well. Can you check them and upload the picture one more time?

That is weird if you can rotate in the Teleop. Are you sure you are feeding the right rotation to the path planner? Also, what are your PID values for rotation? It would be great to see the path planner part of your code!

Hey, thanks for your response! I’m a programmer on the same team as Rzheng and here is my team’s github. 3984-2024-Crescendo-FINAL/Crescendo-WorkingAuto-03_26_2024/src/main/java/frc/robot at main · Team3984v2/3984-2024-Crescendo-FINAL · GitHub.
We are quite sure we are providing the correct rotation values to pathplanner and from what we’ve found so far, it seems like the AutoBuilder is feeding a chasis speed with rotational velocity of close to zero to our setModuleStates() method even as we change rotation of the path (not heading).

I didn’t have too much time to look up your code but as far as I see the problem is occurring in your resetting method of odometry. (The one you supply to the auto builder in the configure method) You need to reset your gyro with the resetting odometry method.
I added my team’s resetting method in the DriveSubsystem to compare with yours. (We are feeding this to AutoBuilder.configureHolonomic() ) Hope it will be helpful! Feel free to ask if you didn’t understand what I wrote

image843×315 13.1 KB

We’ve been seeing the same issue.
Been wracking our brains at it all season.
Feels like a bug in pathplannerlib to me.

For us, it ignores the rotation target only sometimes. I think it’s related to whether it replans or not.

Are you setting your max module speed equal to you max translational speed? If so, PathPlanner has no overhead to command any rotation.

Thanks! I’m pretty sure we are feeding a reset odometry method very similar to the one you wrote there into our configure holomonic. Can you elaborate on what might be wrong with the reset odometry?

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":15,"updated_at":"2024-04-06T04:23:37.496Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":44,"readers_count":43,"score":18.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":461390,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-autonomous-no-robot-rotation","display_username":"Ryan zheng","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":52583,"username":"ArdaTurkmen","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/ea666f/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55168,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-autonomous-no-robot-rotation/461390/12","custom_user_title":"Programmer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3353301,"name":"","username":"ArdaTurkmen","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/ea666f/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-06T10:47:14.076Z","cooked":"

Let me explain myself. We ran Swerve for 5 competitions right now and as far as I experienced rotation problems are caused either by Swervedrivekinematics or Holonomiccontroller. From your explanations, I think there is no problem with the kinematics because you can rotate basically in Teleop. (And you are not using joystick in autonomous period )
I am almost sure that the Holonomiccontroller that Pathplanner using is taking the current pose, the desired pose, the desired rotation, and the linear speed. As you can make linear translation autonomously, for me the only two options remaining are the desired pose/heading and the current pose. From your picture about Commanded angular velocity, I think the problem is not with the desired pose or heading. (I am not sure about it, If I were you, I would check it as well.) So that is why I was looking for a problem in the current pose, therefore your gyro reading and resetting. You can try to look at your gyro reading and Pathplannerstate reading at the same time to compare them to see the error there. As your PID values for rotation are significantly higher than translations ones the problem might be your rotation error almost is being zero. Hopefully, I did elaborate on my thoughts and help you to solve the issue!

We tried changing the PID values for rotation and translation to be more reasonable values (translation P = 4 ish and rotation P = 4.5ish) and it didn’t seem to affect the path at all. What do you mean about pathplannerstate? Are you talking about the desired state that the robot is being commanded to go to? Sorry for the delayed response, I wasn’t able to test anything until yesterday since we were coming back from a competition.
